text: Unrelated, but one time, we were in a drill lockdown, (it was completely fake and they had told us) and this girl, had to use the bathroom. She was on her period. Even after the drill ended, our teacher didn't let her go. So she went up to his desk, ripped her bloody tampon out, and put it in his coffee.

text: I have been in one of the situations in second grade. There was a shooter in my school, and he like ran towards my door and was banging on it and everyone shakes. My teacher said if she lays on the floor, it is a real drill she laid on the floor I freaked out I was shaking. I was so scared. I had no idea what to do at that moment other than just not talk that was my only purpose not to talk and then all I heard from my friends was giggling my friend was giggling, and I told I like whispered, I forgot I think I passed the piece of paper like I was passing notes and I passed a piece of paper and I was in on that paper. It said I said stop talking because thereâ€™s a shooter here and he didnâ€™t believe me thereâ€™s another bank on the door and he was like open up and the shooter was like open up and my friend. My friend passed me another note and was like OK. Itâ€™s a life shooter. We need to stay calm donâ€™t talk and he told all the other kids around him, luckily to say that the cops did find them in time.
